trans-unit.source: Navigate back to Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: Navigate back to Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Roles** and then highlight your Availability Group.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Roles** and then highlight your Availability Group.

trans-unit.source: On the **Resources** tab, right-click the listener name and click Properties.
trans-unit.target: On the **Resources** tab, right-click the listener name and click Properties.

trans-unit.source: If there are multiple resources listed, verify that the IP addresses have OR, not AND, dependencies.
trans-unit.target: If there are multiple resources listed, verify that the IP addresses have OR, not AND, dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the listener name and click **Bring Online**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the listener name and click **Bring Online**.

trans-unit.source: Once the listener is online, from the **Resources** tab, right-click the availability group and click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Once the listener is online, from the **Resources** tab, right-click the availability group and click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: Create a dependency on the listener name resource (not the IP address resources name).
trans-unit.target: Create a dependency on the listener name resource (not the IP address resources name).

trans-unit.source: Add Dependency on the Listener Name
trans-unit.target: Add Dependency on the Listener Name

trans-unit.source: Launch **SQL Server Management Studio** and connect to the primary replica.
trans-unit.target: Launch **SQL Server Management Studio** and connect to the primary replica.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **AlwaysOn High Availability** | **Availability Groups** | **<AvailabilityGroupName>** | **Availability Group Listeners**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **AlwaysOn High Availability** | **Availability Groups** | **<AvailabilityGroupName>** | **Availability Group Listeners**.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the listener name that you created in Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the listener name that you created in Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the listener name and click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the listener name and click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Port** box, specify the port number for the availability group listener by using the $EndpointPort you used earlier (in this tutorial, 1433 was the default), then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Port** box, specify the port number for the availability group listener by using the $EndpointPort you used earlier (in this tutorial, 1433 was the default), then click **OK**.
